availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Wilson M. May (Jessamine County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier (U.S.A.))

body.p: Jessamine County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Estill County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Ball May in Jessamine County, Kentucky, on July 30, 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and corporal from September 22, 1862 to October 24, 1862. Reported as deserted at Frankfort on October 24, 1862. Farmer in Jessamine County in 1863. Served in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 6, 1863, to October 5, 1864.
